one_reviews_text: I loved this game and paid the full price of £30, after a recent move to a Quest 2 from a Rift CV1, I thought I would experience the game again with some clearer higher fidelity graphics, turns out that when you pay for a game, you don't actually own it and get to play it whenever you want!! Absolute shambles! Crytek/Meta need to fix this as it is not a good look for the platform as a whole!
please fix it

Not working!!!
I used to play it a lot, last time I've tried to play it and it didn't even launch.
I've reinstalled it and still, it's not working!!!
Won't run on my CV1 anymore, used to work fine but i just get a crash error when i try to run it now.

review_title: no longer working on Oculus Rift S
one_reviews_text: I write this review because of a problem. Robinson: The Journey has been an awesome game. I bought and played it in early 2021, almost a year ago, and it worked fine. Now it doesn't even start, which is why I removed and reinstalled it, but it didn't help. I use Oculus Rift S. If Robinson: The Journey ever starts to work again like it did, I think it has value of 5 stars. Until then, it is not worth buying.

review_title: DOES NOT WORK WITH OCULUS LINK/AIRLINK
one_reviews_text:
This game does not work with Link or AirLink for the quest or quest 2. I have reached out to support and am awaiting a response. Was great on my CV1, but does not work on newer hardware - in need of a patch. 

DO NOT BUY IF YOU ARE PLANNING TO USE VIA LINK OR AIRLINK.
This no longer starts when connected to Quest 2. Worked about 6 months ago. Devs please fix as I’d like to finish the game.

review_title: Does not work on quest 2 anymore.
one_reviews_text:
some months ago it runs perfect with Link and virtual desktop.
But now its not working anymore: not in Link/AirLink or virtual desktop.
Support contacted. Oculus pls help!

I purchase your app for my Rift, works great.  I replaced my Rift with a new Quest 2. it is mental to think someone is going to repurchase your app for a newer hardware, but same system (Facebook). I refuse to purchase it again due to newer version of the quest 2 I have. I would like my purchase moved to my lol same Facebook account under my quest 2. BTW I had to replace my rift due to Oculus not supporting the purchase of new Headset cables.
I need assistance, dont work, message error every time when start game, I tryed unistall and istall, but dont work again, you can help me?

- Bad or even NO physics
- Bad leveldesign, made with complete ignorance regarding holes in the world
- very bad movement behavior: you can ONLY walk in slow-motion
- no description for tasks you need to do to proceed in the story
- after climbing you have a 50% chance to fall down again because the final move to reach the top is not working correctly
SUMMARY:
This is by far the worst VR-experience I ever had !!!
It seems the developers did not have the mood to creat a good game. Nothing here is finished, nothing is sufficiently working. Even the simpliest things are bad like grabbing something is not working with the triggers like in 99.99 VR-games - nope - it's the button (A) that you need to press - I mean WTF????
On top of it you have a multitool to let items hover, to scan and to I don't know what the third mode is - it does nothing. Well this multitool is changing it's settings randomly - I REALLY DON'T KNOW WHAT THE DEVS WHERE THINKING when they made this....
I'm not a beginner. I'm CG-artist and developer. It's a shame to charge someone 29€ for such a miserable game - sorry

the biggining of story sounds fun but the graphic dosen't seem to imporve. I have a rtx 2060 super but every thing is blury and changing the setting makes no diffrence. could be my computer having problem but can't play this.
Tried it once, and gave up. Tried it again and now it's going to get uninstalled

This was an amazing game that made me figure out problems. And it had some intense heart racing moments. The story is very pleasant and the characters are lovable. I would very much like to see a sequel to this game!

I played this on PSVR and planned to play it through on Oculus with the improved visuals, but the recent patch to add touch support has made the game crash on running.  Robinson: The Journey: Status -92. I've logged a ticket with support but cannot play the game at all at the moment.

Just got around to playing this game. Yes, the environments look good, but the game is flawed. I couldn't get past a puzzle due to glitches with the dumb dinosaur who is supposed to be your pet. Very frustrating. The game is slow paced, which was nice for just chilling but ultimately got too frustrated trying to figure out what I'm supposed to be doing and then why it's not working. Gave up on it after about 3-4 hours so tried to enjoy it best I could. Do not recommend at all unless free.
I love everything about this game, the story, the graphics and the dinosaurs, everything! Please make a part 2 to this game :).

I bought this in 2017 when I first bought my Rift but never got around to playing it as I prefer action games. Due to lockdown I've been dusting off my unplayed games and decided to give this a try. It really does look beautiful and graphically it trounces most more recent VR titles hands down. As you would expect it is very cool to wander around dinosaur land in VR. The game falls down badly though in controls and gameplay. Walking around like someone has tied your shoelaces together is not immersive. Neither is wandering around like a spare tool trying to figure out what you are supposed to do. Your 'helper' robot is so useless, if you really were stranded on an alien planet you would be dead in a day. Overall, it's fun to explore, but the fun is cancelled out by the frustrating gameplay. The graphics team deserve a massive pat on the back, the game design team deserve a massive, steaming, T-Rex pat on the head.

I never thought I'd see the day when a game from Crytek was so bad I was unable to play it.  The biggest problem right off the bat, no way to run or speed up walking, which is painfully slow.  The graphics have potential to be amazing, as it's on the CryEngine.  But super sampling outside the game doesn't work and the in game setting maxes out at 2x.  My GPU is only operating at 55% usage, I could bump up the resolution significantly, but for some reason it doesn't work.  I'm an adult, playing a game where the main character is a child does not appeal to me.  It's too wholesome to be enjoyable and I don't have enough free time to dump into a game that's not fun.
The world in the game also has a ton of potential. You're lost on a Jurasic planet with gigantic dinosaurs all around you and environments that are extremely intriguing.  The climbing mechanics are fun, just like that game The Climb, also made by Crytek.  But that game was actually a lot of fun, challenging in a way that wasn't irritating.  This game, you'll get to a point where you have no idea what you're supposed to do, the robot assistant isn't saying anything, there's nowhere to go and the controls are so poor you can't do anything with them.  Sadly, I knew immediately, within the first 5 mintues I wasn't going to like this game. But I gave it a chance to pull me in, and it failed miserably.  The fact this is from Crytek, the makers of Crysis, really disappoints me. 
One thing that should be made known right away is that this game is from when VR had just come out.  Games have come a long way and I guess they were experimenting with what would work early on.  I never had any issues with motion sickness, I never have on any game.  I typically hate teleportation, but in this game that would actually be a blessing.  I bought this game months ago when it was on sale and just got to it today.  Wish I had tried it when I bought it so I could get a refund, now I'm stuck with this steaming pile of wasted money.

review_title: This is a nice exploration game. But....
one_reviews_text: This game has a great environment, art and atmosphere. But the moving around is really bad and gives a motion sickness right away. I wonder why they did not implement teleportation controls. Although, I bought this game, I'm not going to be playing it at all.
This game could be good, but I can't enjoy it with the bad controller interface, why have hands in the game if you can't use them as you do in any other games, to much frustration to play!!
Great idea for a game but poor tutorial and horrible controls.
I loved this game!  Was amazing to play and I hope that an expansion or further chapters will be available.  I will be one of the first to buy!  Thanks for an amazing journey!

review_title: No teleport. Prone to motion sickness
one_reviews_text: Terrible movement controls and the lack of teleport movement makes it a pass for me, being prone to motion sickness

review_title: One of the best and worst
one_reviews_text:
Extreme highs and lows.
First highs:
-One is stranded on a Jurassic planet, dinos everywhere. One has a baby TRex as pet, a hovering drone assistant bot and a gravity beam tool.
-The graphics can be set to look AMAZING. Easily among the best 5 visuals in VR available, still, today.
The game by default sets itself to no good settings where all is blurry and anything further than 3 meters extra blurry and way worse detail. But one can go into the settings and disable TSAA and instead increase the render scale and enable high quality distant objects. 
With those settings the game is stunning looking. 
When one walks around and has the gorgeous scenery and huge dinos walking and flying around, it is a sight to behold and something extremely worth experiencing. I regularly paused to just take in all the visual amazement.

The gameplay is a nice change of pace, it is about exploring, doing slight physics puzzles and walking and climbing around or giving the pet dino instructions and scanning and looking for items.

So far, i would give this an A for very well done and exceptional VR classic material.

Sadly, there are some quite low lows, too:
-The controls: bad: unintuitive mapping, things which should be done with touch hand usage needing multiple button mappings, pulling oneself up while climbing not working half the time, no run speed, in between i even regularly got stuck where i could only move a mm until i got out of the collision area.
The onboarding first hour until one learns the controls not great.
Some tasks not intuitive, one can get lost and the robot assistant not giving good help.
The story is middling, one looks for why the ship crashed, ends right when it would get about present instead of past.

Why i still played through the thing and give it 4 stars? Because the highs are so high and all lows could be adressed with two weeks on controls and help system. It has 95% awesome and 5% which messes it up. I want a second part with those fixed so much.

The motion sickness trying to move around in the game is so bad I can't stay in it longer then a minute or two...  is there a 'click teleport' option that I'm missing? I can spend hours in VR moving with teleport but walking around with the environment going up and down around me is just messing with me too much.  Is there an option to switch to teleport and not have to have blurred environment move by?

The game is beautiful, but I was unableto appreciate it since I kept getting sick and having to stop after 15 minutes. I do not for the life of me understand why they have not included blink/teleport movement like every other sensible VR game out there. If the game had this one detail I imagine I would have an entirely different impression, but with the awkward slow walking and the clunky unresponsive interaction with objects in the game I cannot stand to play it  without wanting to throw up and getting frustrated.

A stunning expirience and nicely made without the need for shooting and killing. Making Robin to survive his journey brings you along in a fantastic world of plants and animals, dinosaurs and stunning creatures. You may want to just stand at the edge of a canyon and watch the scenery. I loved this game. Not one single glitch or hang. Fluently done and nice story too!

Ok, this game looks great, but it is a NIGHTMARE to control. First, the boy you play is unbelievable slow and cumbersome. Trying to grab something, pull something... it feels terrible. But the worst is the climbing.

Yes you have to manually climb, like pull yourself ledge to ledge, and with the unprecise touch control it's a bloody nightmare. I tried one of the climb puzzles, and the first hour I ended up falling to death all the time. It says "pull yourself up", but it doesn't work 90% of the time.

Then when I  FINALLY managed to get up to the nest, the character glides into some non-move zone and is STUCK. The developers have stopped working on the issue, as the years old scarecrow bug shows. The scarecrow itself is no big issue but it shows the developers dont give a crap after getting their money.

Adding climbing is quite a challange, but with such cumbersome controls it is NO FUN. I dont know how many times I tried, only to be stuck in the graphics. NO NO NO I WANT MY MONEY BACK! >:(

Btw, if I go to the website https://www.robinsonthegame.kayako.com/ which the developer recommends, the browser says "unsafe" and if I continue anyway there is no website at all. I mean... what the bloody heck.

Good thing: Start with low resolution, but after proper setting, resolution turn better Gaphic become very good. Character move not too fast, we can expore around, not easy to get dizzy. Bad thing: Is that there lacking of hints, dont know what to do next.

i've purchased the game 4 months ago and every week i try the game but it does not it, i can see its starting the game and then it trows itself out and i 'm back in the libary again.Can someone help with this and maybe explain my problem??

I just got the rift S and was excited to play this game.  Every time I open the game it does not load. I checked for errors using virtual desktop and there was an error that appeared. I submitted a ticket with the error code and no response yet from CryTek.  I bought the other CryTek game, The Climb, and it throws the same error.  Maybe its a cryengine issue, but only happens with those 2 CryTek games. I will change my review once fixed or if nothing happens in the next 10 days I will refund my purchases.

review_title: Does Not Function On The Rift S At All
one_reviews_text:
I had just got my Oculus Rift S and wanted to play a nice vr game so I bought this game along with The Climb. However, after installation when I opened them, they both did not open and I got an error.  I will change my review once this is fixed.

Update: It has been fixed. The game is fun to play mostly with multiple spots of pure boredom. But, overall a good VR game.

review_title: I like Robinson: The Journey so much.
one_reviews_text:
I have Robinson in both psvr, steam, and oculus.
There are many Koreans who are not experienced in Korean language.
I look forward to a new vr game from Crytek.
Thank you.

Just two words. "Planitarium" and "Raptors" Enjoyed this game, even with the clunky controls until that part of the game. Oculus has GRIP BUTTONS, impliment them instead of trigger buttons. Other than that, it's a great story and the Higgs Unit that guides you is great. I hope there is a sequel with no poorly done Metal Gear Stealth levels with Raptors.
Has different setup requirments, once you set it up correctly works fine.

Got this on sale at a ridiculously low price and wow what a surprise.  Beautiful graphics, environments, creatures...awesome detail just beautiful.  Laika is so adorable and the adventure is challenging and fun.  I love the climbing and the 'zip lines'...very exhilaratibg!

As others mentioned the Touch implementation is awkward but manageable.  The richness of the graphics and the living critters makes up for any flaws in the controls.

review_title: dont run on the new oculus rift s
one_reviews_text:
just bought this for the new oculus rift (may 23 2019) its crashing, guess one of the games what are not really supporting the rift s.
hope this will be fixed soon, cause the game itself is a must to have for vr
Sorry but not interesting

First off, I do think this is a very good game. But I'm giving this game 2 stars (for now) because the hand tracking is so Bad. I move my hands towards the ground they start to spin on some weird axis. It's so bad my hands will spin behind my body. This Never happens on any other game. Not "Job SImulator" or "Rick and Morty" or any of my 40+ games. I though it was my 2 gen intel PC, but I upgraded my computer to a 8 gen intel and my hand still spin behind my body when go near the ground.  I really hope the developers fix this hand tracking issue because I'd really like to play this game again.
review_feedback: Hi |||ZoNeR|||, We're sorry you're having issues. If you would like to receive some assistance, please don't hesitate to contact us at https://robinsonthegame.kayako.com/

one_reviews_text: One of the greates VR games Oculus Rift have. Very high quality product from idea  to technical incarnation.  Great immersion, stuning surroundings, usefull interface, interesting quests and puzzles - absolutely polished project. So hope to see second pard of this game one day.

This is very concerning. We pay for a game that randomly stops working and have to rely on Crytek or Oculus to fix it, or we're just screwed. And neither have addressed the issue at all in ANY public forum. Fantastic. What happens in a few years when this happens again? Not comfortable being at the mercy of mega corporations that only pay attention if there's money at stake.

(+) The graphics in Robinson are absolutely gorgeous and crisp! It feel like my rift just got a resolution update. 
Beside being a game it feels like a nature simulator: Not only dinosaurs, but even small bugs are depicted in great detail in their everyday life as well as stunning flora. Even the first flowering plants  are seen and early mammals are running around. In the skies different types of dino-birds and even the first known feathered bird Archeopterix! 
The only other VR game with the same attention to detail  I've seen so far was Lone Echo. This game is very much up there. It is also very atmospheric with the music and the sounds of the animals and it often adds suspense at the right moments.  
(-)
-The touch controls are implemented very basic. No pointing or other gestures.
-Tip: climbing up a cliff it took me forever to find out that I needed to outstretch my arms completely upwards; fists clenched and then lower them  to summit a ridge.
-In the farm I got stuck next to the pterodactylus nest on a cliff and had to restart the entire adventure; losing all my progress. Nowhere else did that happen and it only happened once.
-Some directions on how to use my touch controllers were wrong, but I quickly found the solution (the makers mixed up left and right touch).
-Game does seem to be abandoned by the developers ; last update 9 months ago despite some obvious bugs.
-------------------------------------------------------
Aside from the small negatives Robinson is still highly recommended!!

First of all, its not an ego shooter, so this adventure is also suitable for the younger ones. Graphic is gorgeous  (like lone echo) and the puzzles are nice.
Only the  touch controls are a little bit sluggish.
Hint: To avoid nausea, set the oversampling rate to 1, that works for me.

Waiting for a sequel
the game is in spanish i am unabel to start as i only speek english can sumone help re downloade it is ok in english  good game.
review_feedback:
Hi Dylanmax,

We're sorry you're having issues. Please feel free to contact us on our support page, and we'll try to figure out the source of your problems as soon as possible!

https://robinsonthegame.kayako.com/

one_reviews_text:
Ok, it's not completely bug-free, and the touch controls could have been implemented in a better way (or at least have a better tutorial in the beginning). Initially, it's hard and a bit counter-intuitive to do things.

But it quickly gets better, the story is great, the graphics unbelievable, puzzles are quite complex yet not impossible to solve, and it's so immersive. So many different creatures, and both the tiny ones and the giant ones (oh, they can be SO big!) are extremely detailed and fluid in their motions.

Finally, the fact that you have to collaborate with cute Laika (the baby T-Rex) to proceed in the game is just a source of pure fun.

If you prefer to live an adventure instead of shooting everything that moves, than you'll find out this game is worth all the money it costs!

Fabulous adventure game. TBH...i almost quit the game due to difficulty using the controller funtions... Its not intuitive at all.  And there isnt much guidance if you get stuck. But i'm glad i stuck it out. Once the game starts going and you get a handle on controller fcn...the game is amazing.  I dont know why this game isnt getting more stars. I think there are some VR gamers who prefer the physical action and shooting kinds of games. But Robinson is for the adventure gamer who likes to take their time with the details of the game, such as storyline, scenery & puzzles.

Lots to explore. Never a dull moment in this game!
epic journey in a world filled with dinos with your flying robot friend  amazing!!

review_title: Some good, some bad, not really my genre
one_reviews_text:
Good - Great voice acting, nice sense of scale
Bad - blurry graphics for me (on a very high-end setup), slow pace, seems to require backtracking but not sure, only barely passable Touch implementation

All in all if you like slow-paced narrative exploration and puzzle games, this is probably worth it on sale.  I didn't enjoy it myself and found it quite boring.  Robot companion voice acting is really great though.
review_feedback: Hello AnnatarRedeened, we are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our game! If you wish to receive any assistance or to leave any feedback, don't hesitate to contact us at any time! https://robinsonthegame.kayako.com/

one_reviews_text: I really love this game but I cannot get past opening the gate to The Farm because Laika is not responding to my laser point + A request. Little eye in the sky dude just floats above me.  I'll restart again to see if its a buggy issue. Otherwise beautiful VR world....I hope I can get this to work as I want to explore .
Just finished it. Excellent story thrills, chills and lots of excitement. Increadible scenery.Takes a little time with controls. Hoping for continuation of this story.

review_title: T-rex not answering to orders with Touch
one_reviews_text:
Bought the game tried to tell the T-rex to go to here and there, but no response with touchs ( A key don't respond ), but it is ok with gamepad, so fix this asap please !
Thx.

I had a really good time playing through this!
Although I'd wish for a bit more after the ending, in overall the game was a lot of entertainment, and the mechanics I knew from "The Climb" already worked perfectly in this one as well.

The only few times I can remember I've been genuinely touched by a dinosaur game that much has been "Jurassic Park: The Game" (Adventure) and the really old "Trespasser" from 1998.
Robinson I'll remember very much as well now! :)
This is the ONLY game in which I suffer motion sickness. Don't know why.

I've completed the game & really enjoyed the game. This gameworld just looks absolutely stunning and due to its beautiful graphics, it is so immersive you feel like you're actually there. I played with touch and I've had absolutely no controller issues. Aircar and Alien Isolation without snap turning made me quesy when played almost a year ago. This game has not made me feel quesy at all. This is a great exploration/adventure type game and very immersive like you're actually there. This is what VR is about, and this game does this really well. The low ratings by others? Well this game has dinosaurs so probably attracts a lot of newbie VR players without VR legs. This game came out as a gamepad only game. Motion controls were implemented later. Maybe initial implementation wasn't good but got updated later with better controls. Even recent complaints of controller issues are probably those who are just repeating what they read. Controller issues are minor if anything. I certainly had no issues at all. Tip: when moving objects, you need to hold both controller triggers and use both thumbsticks. The game advises that. Using one contoller, manevouring becomes very difficult. Maybe that is the complaint. Not the games fault if you missed the advice. The jungle, the tar pit and planetarium areas of this game are bloody amazing to play. This is a must play game and one of my favourite vr titles.

I just finished the game/experience and must say I really enjoyed it. Its worth the money. The graphics, polish and performance is on another level. I run mine maxed with x 1.7 supersampled and must say the prehistoric theme is incredibly well exectued with beatuful scenery and colorful views. I took one star away as the inplementation of Touch controllers is pretty basic with weird button layout. Forget Lone Echo type of controls. Here you use pointer and antigravity force to lift objects, hands are there only for immersion only (not even gestures).  I imagine this is due to porting from PSVR where the requirement is frontfacing 180 with move controllers. So at times you will struggle to get things done. This problem dissapear later as you get used to the controls but still I find this missed opportunity. Game itself is very slow paced which is cool for me as I like to explore and take it all in. Also this game my be a problem for poeple who could not stomach stick motion.
Won’t open, doesn’t work

one_reviews_text: Well that was different and enjoyable.

Beautiful graphics, stunning views over  valleys and the climbing elements are awsome (just dont look down). I was looking for an alternative to Lone echo after enjoying that game immensly. I came across Robinson the Journey on sale and was not dissapointed. A similiar experience but with gravity. 
Have heard a few negative comments regarding the rift controllers but I had no problem with them.  The controllers work great with the climbing elements. If you are looking for an alternative to Lone Echo or a game to fill that gap until Lone Echo 2 comes out then you cant go far wrong with this little beauty.
If you see it on sale then snap it up you wont regret it.
Thankyou for a great immersive beautiful game.
Unbelievlably Graphics and details

Great game except it's the only game I've ever gotten sick in. And because the game is interesting at the same time I got so sick I actually threw up. I mean im the type of guy that never get's seasick or sick because of alcohol or sick because of rollercoasters, never in my entire life those things affected me in the slightest but this game made me cascade puke. 10/10 would puke again.

This looks ok..but I found it incredibly slow and boring. Much better stuff out there now for the price. THe controls are overly complicated and the robot side kick voice makes me want to  smash something.

Don't buy this game if you have motion sickness.....I'm totally fine in all the other VR games but this one......As soon as I move around I got nauseous, has to quit game and lie flat for a while to recover. 
Other wise, beautiful game, well made, wish you can move around by teleporting yourself.....
I cant give this game a good reveiw because it wont even open, please help and I will change my rating
review_feedback:
Hi moabdave1,

We're sorry you're experiencing this problem. If you're still experiencing issues, feel free to contact us on our support page, we'll try and help solve this issue as soon as possible!

https://robinsonthegame.kayako.com/

one_reviews_text:
Seeing some of the previous reviews one would think this game is bad but that is not the case. Indeed, had they perservered  this game ups the stakes with increasingly clever levels from verticgo inducing climbs into "avatar" style trees to crossing bubbling mud swamps filled with huge dinosaurs, to meeting some raptors and a T-Rex.   With the help of your pet "baby" t-rex which you find is needed on later levels to complete and a floating droid giving you "input" along the way you set out hopefully to find other survivors when you find yourself marooned alone on a hostile planet.   The graphics are top notch with various graphic settings for weaker PC's  and resembles a cross between Avatar and the Jurassic period. The levels are designed with many puzzles which at first can confuse but I quickly figured out how to solve them gaining experience along the way that would prove invaluable in later levels. Some critisism has been aimed at controls but I had no problem with the Oculus touch; indeed climbing cliff faces etc was not a problem and was very intuitive despite some criticising difficulty in doing this.   Without spoiling later levels I found the pace steady with heart pumping adrenalin later levels especialy trying to avoid some raptors retreiving a battery only to find I needed to retread my steps with no save point hence lots of tension and sweating. 
      All this is augmented by the Oculus experience with the VR really putting you in the settings with graphics courtesy of the Crysis engine I believe.  Replay value is dependant on what you were hoping in the game in the first place but having completed the game I found some more things added which I look forward to checking out later.  For the price £10, this is outstanding value and recommended for dinosaur lovers as long as you don's suffer from vertigo because there's lots of hanging in mid space with shear drops made worse by the VR experience. lol

Completed in just over 4 hours. The puzzles arent that bad, they just require a little out of the box thinking or wait for hints from the robot. Droped a start due to the length of the game. Hope they release a sequel

Took me about 5 hours to beat doing most of the tasks. Game can be a little criptic at time and I def had to check youtube 3-4 times when stuck. Could use a few hints here and there! It's fun however, and worth it if you pick it up on a sale.

I bought the game in oculus store AND on steam. They both install and when I press start. In oculus headset I see starting Robinson: The Journey. And then it says "Sorry, Robinson: The Journey is taking a while to load''. And it just gets stuck on this screen... I have been trying to get this game to launch for 3 days in a row now... I want to play it so bad!

...realy amazing graphics and OST/sounds. Unfortunately also too much buggy, special when you climb to the pterodactyl's nest - this part is absolutely frustrating because this bugs on the up (when you cannot easy go to the nest), or you freeze there in rocks or another bugs with metal pieces... this is not mistakes of the player. So climb switching fall, death and upload last save then next climb and faaaaal....etc near nuber "25" times death,.. again and again and of course it must ending by switch off the game. Very pity that beta testers do not work their job correctly or developers do not listen...or lost too much hours for graphics but game's bugs fix is missing. Realy big shame for so expensive game. Some puzzles are little difficult without some helpers but this is good part - is very nice to search in a beautifull areas, special with scanner and looking for some new species, special if you like in another games to be a picker as me. ;o) Anyway I think that I am still on the start of the game so maybe then I will correct rating, yet :)
Fantastic game, just to short. Hope they add more to it.

I bought this when it came out, but only got around to playing it now. Still has amazing graphics and atmosphere I was really impressed. Sure, it’s a little non-interactive, but all I wanted was to walk through massive skyboxes and see huge dinosaurs and it delivers that in spades. Just long enough for me, no complaints on the length.

I wasnt sure as the reviews were a mixed bag but wow this game really impressed me, if you want that feeling of your jaw dropping like when you first saw Jussaic Park in the cinema (if you are old like me) you will get it in this game. I remember when I first heard about VR, this was the game I imagined with dinosaurs. The actual game play is pretty solid with elements of The Climb (I actually thought I was play that game at one point)and Portal but the sheer amount of creatures and dinosaurs is incredible. I would say Robinson is an essential for the Oculus Rift and not sure why its getting so much flack, I heard it didnt used to support touch and no you cant interact with everything like pick up stuff but those things are mainly static but you can climb and hold onto ziplines but most of what you do is scan things kinda like portal but yes it now has touch support and you can move your hands about. The graphics are hands down the best on the Rift so far and I love the scifi elements in the game, I havent got to the end yet but if my theory is correct I will be so happy coz it would be a perfect twist. Well worth it in the sale. Update this is in my top 3 VR gamess, its blown me away.

Played this right through now and overall I liked it. Graphics were really good and it was very atmospheric. Overall story was also pretty good and there were some genuine jawdropping moments. Negatives I'd say... many of the puzzles weren't necessarily difficult, just a matter of randomly trying different control methods rather than actaul brain power. Without Youtube I think I'd have just given up at the first hurdle as the really weren't intuitive or rewarding... so gameplay was poor IMO. Critical items were easy to miss. Really think they could have done away with the annoying pet t-rex to simplify the controls a bit. Also the kids voice is really irritating. It's shame there weren't more dinosaurs also but my biggest complaint SPOILER ALERT HERE is at the very end when the t-rex appears.... that's the absolute climax of the game.. and the game forces me to look down and do that stupid scanning thing on the annoying cutesy t-rex instead of looking at the one thing I've been playing the whole game to see! Then, I have to turn around and run away from it, then play the daft energy link up mini game.... seriously i can't believe that that's the only time you actual get to see the adult t-rex in the whole game... very disappointing. Infact, based on that, I think a 3 out of 5 is actually right :-D

review_title: Needs more touch and interaction support
one_reviews_text:
It's nice that there is touch now, would not have bought it otherwise, great premises, and great graphics. Though the touch is an after thought and comes across that way too, forced to interact with objects only via the tool just seems frustrating.

The story or premises is nice but forced to play as an annoying boy and hearing his voice just gets on my nerves. Would have prefered to choose out of a number of characters, such maybe get to choose out of the kids family, father, mother, older brother or sister. Anyways, nice to have I know and wishful thinking don't expect this title to change much since it's been out for sometime.

A darker side to the story would have been nice too, rather this upbeat hey we're stranded but all good because I'm alive.

This is a truly beautiful game, and most of all this game may be considered an adventure game - it does in some aspects remind me of the PC game Trespasser. Touch controls are implemened and you can grab some objects and climb - well, mostly like in Crytek's other VR game The Climb ;-) But it is cumbersome to grab ledges and pull yourself up - I've died MANY times, but with a lot of practice you'll learn to manage. Adding pieces to fix a broken windmill using Touch got my blood pressure sky high. So Touch controls are often bad - and you'll sweat and swear a lot. And you'll need TONS of patience (like "oh, well, I died again, oh my, but let's keep smiling and try for the 15th time"). Apart for some - occassionally - massive control frustration the game is a great expericence. Life is everywhere from the smallest insects in the air and on the ground to the largest dinos ever known; I've never seen a game world with such a massive amount of living organisms before. This is truly Jurassic World, and it really feels like being there - don't buy Ark Park or The Climb, you'll get it all in this game! ;-) You don't feel much alone thanks to the two AIs, your guide-bot and your pet baby t-rex. If I was a teenager again, to play this game I'd happily simulate a stomach pain to stay home from school - it's that good, but not right from the beginning. Don't give up on this game and get a refund before you've at least visited the Jungle and fixed the Farm. In many ways the graphics - although textures aren't always sharp - are just as impressive as Lone Echo. I'm running the game using highest settings for graphics including super sampling at 2.0 - ok, I did use normal antialiasing, temporal antialiasing looked too blurry. No matter the antialiasing I did not notice any frame dropping on an oc'ed GTX 1080 with i7 7700K and 16GB PC3200. If this game had Touch controls implemented like in Lone Echo (and I want arms, not just hands! :-) this game would deserve 7/5 stars ;-)

I attempted to find the "Back to Dinosaur Island" demo that Crytek released a while back and couldn't find it. It is obvious they used their expertise from that demo, "The Climb" and their amazing outdoor engine to create a truly beauthiful title which serve as a great demo for anyone who wants to know what VR is all about. I find a few of the story elements to be a bit cheesy, and the controls to be unituitive, but I'm still loving the title. I'm more a fan of the teleport method of locomotion in VR, but this uses a slow joystic movement system which so far hasn't given me motion sickness.

Unnecessarily difficult puzzles the game is unplayable wihtout youtube videos for showing how to advance  
everything is purely ramdom the game dont tell you any tips how to advance graphics are old

I'd describe this more as an interactive film than a game per se. It is graphically beautiful, especially on a high end system.

Nice balance of puzzle vs enjoyable experience, with a number of "wow" moments.

I'd put this up there with The Gallery, Xing and Ethan Carter.

review_title: AWE FACTOR TOP NOTCH! LOVE IT!
one_reviews_text:
I really enjoyed this game! This game can definately be added to. I would love for a further storyline, and gameplay, even more intricate and complex puzzles. The sizing of the Dinos, was amazing, some of the best graphics. The raptors! OMG the best parts were where i was scared! 
I get the whole VR Dizzy factor, sometimes i felt as though i wasnt moving fast enough (tho sneaking around raptors, the speed, was of course perfect, i was wanting to move faster adrenalin rushing through me wanting to run!) lolol
PLEASE BRING MORE CONTENT! :D 
P.S. Sometimes after given told what to do, i forgot the combination of buttons to use. Such as moving objects. Scaning took me a while to figure out. Eventually figured it out, kinda liked that part, but at the same time didnt feel  100% clear. 

Editited -There are certain aspects to this game i would like to have an option to replay a certain senerios so i can have my friends do those parts without me having to go through the whole game again.

An awesome experience, the best i had until now(yes i have played, Robot Recalled, Elite etc). Its the best looking graphics in Oculus store and it has a wonderful world of nature and creatures that will leave you with your mouth open.  Its just breathtaking and this game is the reason i bought VR. Also with latest touch patch climbing feels so natural. The game is an adventure, basically it constist of interacting with the enviroment to solve puzzles, climbing and a mini game to gather info about the creatures. No shooting in the game! My first 5 stars.
evenmtually touch controllers responded but not very good.  Anyway i will keep trying to see how it goes.
Joke category!Horrible direction!Old graphics!Full pixels!

its just boring silly riddle stuff. the graphics looks like a old game from 2010!! NO action! and just full scripted bad animated dino's who looks like plastic! and i turned all graphic setting on maximum because i have a highend pc with 1080 ti. worst 6 gb ever. i deleted it with a smile in my face :D
Good game, just started it, graphics are absolutley amazing.
The game is excellent, but after uninstall I have problem with playing again. Re-installing stops at 6,57 GB, tries to download more and stops.

I heard GREAT things about this game! Loaded it, started playing. All you do is walk around camp touching stuff and letting the little dino out?? Or am I missing something? Please tell me I am missing something. This is a game of fetch..no adventure whatsoever.

I know some people are turned off because its a full priced game and its a bit short but I had an amazing experience. This is a game experience that will stay with me, which is the kind of thing that is well worth the price. The world is amazing. Of course I'm a bit biased because I love dinosaurs, but this game made me very happy.

Second Look:

My original review (below) was written in Sept of 2017.  While I stand by what I wrote at the time, I feel obliged to point out a few things: I am more tolerant of freeform motion than I thought I'd ever be, and Oculus now allows for refunds, so it isn't as applicable as it used to be.  Why do I still think little of this game?  Because it doesn't work.  There's a point where I'm instructed to point the laser sight at a place in the ground and tap the A button to make my pet dinosaur stand there.  I do this and nothing happens.  I instruct the dinosaur the exact way I'm instructed to in the game and the dinosaur doesn't move.  Am I doing something wrong or is it a glitch?  Either way my patience runs out and I give up playing the game.  I've started it from scratch probably five times and I keep running into this problem.  I imagine there would be more bad reviews if this was a common issue, so I'm inclined to think I'm doing something wrong or there is some glitch specific to my computer.  Either way, I don't get to play the game I'd very much like to finish.  Kinda hard to give a good review to that kind of experience.

Original Review:

Lacking a teleport option for movement, even two seconds of walking around with the joystick gives me motion sickness.  And apparently there isn't a refund option for North America.  This will be the last game I purchase from the Oculus Store.  I'll be using Steam exclusively going forward as they have a reliable refund option.
review_feedback: Hello AaronSteinmetz, we are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy our game! If you wish to receive any assistance or to leave any feedback, don't hesitate to contact us at any time! https://robinsonthegame.kayako.com/

one_reviews_text: one of the best looking but not the best game. Should be for free or max £10, not worth £29.99, thats not a game you must have, just ok for 30 min, after that boring and sick generator.

Robinson is an adventure game with nice graphics, environment, voiceacting and story. Everything is well done to get you immersed.   There's lots of exploration to do with achievement/progression tables and extra bonuses to get. It's one of the larger games out there and a must have for adventure game lovers.

review_title: Like the higs, Like the game
one_reviews_text: The voice of the higs guide is annoying to some but OK to me. A fine game but a little too much organized into sequences that must be learned... still a good game.

review_title: This is what VR is about!
one_reviews_text:
Prior to the Touch support patch, I couldn't play the game. Something about proper Touch controls goes a long way toward making games like this comfortable in VR. Finally, this is the game it always wanted to be and should have been. Kudos, Crytek - Robinson is now a must-own VR game.

Now maybe sell us some DLC for The Climb, please ;-)

The creatures and landscapes are breathtaking.  Love the dioramas too.

Touch update: You don't feel like those are your hands because they are off position,  the gloves doesn't match with your real hands. I understand the lack of gestures but the hands should be in the right place! Please fix it...

Before as a gamepad only game, this was 3.5 out of 5, having touch controllers adds a new level of awesome to this game. I don't particularly care for how you lift yourself up on a ledge, but this is a great experience.

I'm in the opening scene, baby dinosaur breaks out of egg, snaps at a butterfly.  Its very impressive visuals and soundscape, but my touch controls don't work.  They work as far as choosing menu options, but not gameplay.  I want to feed the t-rex!  I don't want to give a low star rating but until I can play, not much I can do. .3 stars for the visuals

review_title: Great Game, Controls could be better.
one_reviews_text: I am a huge crytek fan from crysis. Controls could be better, i enjoyed it.

Good sound immersion, graphics are beautiful but not the best ever seen. There are bugs : textures clipping, aliasing... fix this and it will give more immersion !
Feel lonely in this game but nice trip in a  dino world !

This is a early game, so I don't expect the best graphics or Touch controls. It's a straightforward puzzle game. The control movement is the biggest problem. It doesn't move naturally. You feel like you are in a hover chair instead of being the character. Movements are jerky. You move diagonally a lot. I don't like heights, and moving this way up in the trees is disorienting.
Way better now. Love the immersion. Especially the climbing feels awesome now

I was really excited about playing this particular game. Unfortunately my disapointment was almost immeadiate.  The game is disorienting, which I expected, but the inability to use the touch controls really is the worst part about it and the arm placement with out the touch control is really uncomfortable.  I would hold off on buying this one untill they add touch support (if that ever happens).

Ok we have touch,for this one star more.
It would be 5 stars when it would work for what the touch is made for!!
This was terrible with gamepad but now his has touch its excellent, i am not very far into it but its very good excellent graphics and sound.
will not load , just throws me to lobby..refund
Felt a bit sick and disorientated playing this game for some reason. Very good graphics but some of the puzzles are slightly tedious or frustrating. Mediocre overall.

review_title: One of the best looking VR experiences
one_reviews_text: The visuals are just stunning and now it also supports Touch which makes scanning all the animals and climbing way more immersive.
touch + spanish = 5 stars

A  visually stunning adventure game with mild puzzle elements. Reasonably comfortable playing with analogue movement and the option of snap turning.  Game play is at least five hours with the option to play for much longer for all the achievements.  Yes it would have been better with touch, but it came out long before they were a thing and anyone giving a low score based on that is being unfair.
Great experience :)

There is no support for the Touch Controllers and because it is a bad PSVR port there is an arm always in the middle of the screen.
That's ridiculous ...

review_title: A few quirks, but overall pretty decent
one_reviews_text: It's easy to see why some people aren't happy with this. It's such an obvious candidate for Touch controllers, yet it doesn't support them. Treat it like a game from an older generation however, and it's still pretty enjoyable. More complete than most titles, and has a lovely sense of exploration. Gameplay could use a bit more signposting in places, but overall I rather like it.

review_title: Some amazing scenes and decent gameplay
one_reviews_text: Feels a lot more fleshed out than most vr experiences/games. Biggest issue for me is that on a 970 the graphs look a bit blurry.

Its a very relaxing game, dont expect explotions og near death moments. Take it as a dino trip. No touch controls make it not for everyone and i found it kind of borring without it (read non immersive). Good game otherwise.

It was a beautiful game visually stunning.. if you are into dinosours and science fiction, this is the game that combines both worlds in a fantastic way... and the music of the game is also very influential..  I am super impressed... only downside is it does not last very long.. which is a minus.. I would definitely want to see an expansion pack very soon...
I wanted to like this, I don't. It needs touch to even have the slightest value
I hate the last level with the two raptors.
Now that it is working, I will have to get into it a bit and report back with a review. Looks beautiful so far!

I enjoyed this game much more than I expected and found it much better than many of the reviews led me to believe I would.  Yes Touch support would be nice, but it is by no means essential.  The atmosphere in the game is fantastic, the graphics unequalled.  It is a walking simulator with some basic puzzles thrown in, but it is very good at what it does and the VR environment makes it an experience you will have never had before.  Great stuff.

I just wrote a pretty long review for this game, but Oculus refused to accept it, because "profanity" (the evil f-word) and deleted it. Thanks Oculus. I'm really not in the mood to write all that sh!t again, so this one gets a lot shorter: Great game for story-liking explorers. Looks and sounds good. Crashes sometimes when changing graphic settings. Recommended. Go get it.

Absolutely no idea what all the hate is about. This is arguably the best VR game I've ever played. I completed the entire thing in 1 sitting. The graphics, story and sound design is brilliant and I definitely feel like I got my moneys worth! I'll be showing this to everyone I can!

Yeah, touch support would be awesome, more localizations and minor issue improvements too BUT, its a great and smooth experience nonetheless. Played Ark Survival and tried VR but it currently still sucks. IMHO Great alternative to experience a Dinosaur world. Didn't had any issues with bad graphics, performance or motion sickness yet. If you're unsure, wait till a discount becomes available but if you don't mind and want to support developers to get further updates and like a nice afterwork experience... grab it.

love it from the start just what we need, i hope there is a sandbox version this was so graphically satisfying> I honestly don't know why people are complaining about glitches i had absolutely zero i'm running on 300 speed with a gtx 980 and its still stunning with no glitches or crashes at all. i think its just the people who don't have a good system to be fair I've waited for a game like this forever. Definitely worth the investment!!!!

Not many VR games are actually games, they're more like experiences or tech demos. This is a first and actually feels like a proper game. With my GTX 1070 I upped the resolution to 2x and the graphics became a lot better. I would recommend this for around £20, so getting it on sale felt about right for the price.
You feel like you are trapped in another body. The graphics are a bit robotic and lack of touch controls is troubling.

review_title: One of the best experiences yet.
one_reviews_text:
This game is fantastic.
The graphics are top notch.
The game play has action and puzzle adventure elements not to mention climbing and other stuff. It just needs touch support.
I hope the developers add more content and different ways to beat each part while updating it for touch controls because it's a big game world that a lot more hours of gameplay and replay value could be squeezed out of without making new scenes. I'd even pay for DLC for this with new chapters about hunting down other survivors or something. The game isn't too short though. You can get a weekend or two out of it if you don't rush it and savour the experience, but it left me wanting more which is good. It definitely deserves 5 stars even if it doesn't have touch yet.

This is the WORST game I have EVER played. DO NOT buy it. Its broken in so many ways. I wonder if the people that actually made it even played it, because if they did they would have punched themselves in the face!

Thanks Crytek, for this experience. For a while I really was that boy on an alien planet. The climbing went a bit to my stomach, as being afraid of heights, but that´s what I expect from VR. Worth the money.

And by the way: Not a trace of motion sickness for me.

Absolutely excellent immersion feeling with all the surrounding sounds of the jungle and very good graphics. 
Would be best with touch controllers (and then I would give the 5th star).

So please: touch support!!!!!!!

The game itself is fun but they need to have a quest log and quest pointers because I find myself lost looking around on what I was supposed to be doing and where.  For example they said to go fishing but they don't tell you what to do with the cube you get after putting it in the machine.  I would assume you cook it but it does nothing when putting it on the grill.  Another example is they wanted you to repair a scarecrow but they don't tell you when the quest has been completed.

review_title: So where can I get my money back
one_reviews_text: Poor gameplay, silly graphics ... no comment on the navigation.

It's not a Touch game, it's only in English and it feels like the beginning of the story is missing. There's also no "Blink" movement so beware of VR sickness. This can also be finished in about 3 hours. 

On the other hand, the graphics are top notch however and the puzzles are fun without being annoyingly difficult. The environments are absolutely stunning. If they added Touch support and Blink movement this game would be "near" perfect.

This game is very, very short.  I didn't experience any of the sickness others stated but you can easily finish this game in just under three hours.  The end leaves it open for a sequel.  I do hope if they do make one it has more content or they price it more like a series release.  If your not desperate for VR content wait for this to go on sale.

Played it for about 30 mins, this game screams touch enabled yet it isn't. I didn't get any of the bugs other people complain about. I paid good money for touch and not happy that I can't use them also a multiplayer componet  would be great as well Put the graphics all the way up.Comparable to Arizona Sunshine. And yes my computer can run crysis!

Indeed there must be something wrong. I can play in VR for hours too in other games, but in this game I get sick after a few minutes. Please add a teleport-system for users who tend to get motion-sickness!!! And when adding this you can also add touch-controller-support...

Don't listen to all the negative post's about game crashing and being glitchy - these people don't have the horsepower to run the game. They are trying to max out there graphics settings and the game pukes cause their system sucks... I have had no issues with the game. It is quite the experience and a welcome change from other "games" Just chill and enjoy it - the soundtrack is amazing as well. As for the non inclusion of touch support...not a real biggie here - yes it would have been nice but the gamepad suffices.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cpOvai9dpNo - My Thoughts:
Once again Crytek have pushed the boundaries in game play and creativity. This game in VR is a joy to behold. If like me, you have a wonder for dinosaurs and a sense of adventure, this is one VR experience you do not want to miss!

Game Details:
Robinson: The Journey has arrived on Oculus Rift! Experience a mysterious and beautiful world as you navigate dangerous terrain and come face-to-face with dinosaurs in an intensely realistic virtual adventure.

When the Esmeralda crash-lands on Tyson III, a boy named Robin is left stranded. He must rely on his wits – and two unlikely companions – to survive. As he searches for the lost crew, Robin discovers that Tyson III is not the paradise once promised.
 
Immerse yourself in this stunning world and navigate dangerous and awe-inspiring territory on your quest to find what happened to the Esmeralda – and whether you really are the sole survivor.

Alongside AI unit HIGS and baby T-Rex Laika, you will become the first human to explore Tyson III, meet strange and extraordinary creatures and experience the intense realism of a virtual world powered by CRYENGINE.
 
Find the truth about the crash by searching for clues, and explore as the power of the Rift transports you to another planet.

This game is soooo amazing and beautiful!! Graphics are great!! I really dont understand, why some of you are whining!! Its running very smooth, everything is fine. No problem!! Oh Crytek, you did very well. Thank you so much for your work!! Finally a really good game for us here on Oculus Planet ;-)
Can't go wrong with dinosaurs in Cryengine, such a beautiful adventure. Don't put view distance option on very high or it will crash. Adding Touch would also be welcome but I enjoyed in nonetheless.
great game, that could use a little more direction, and faster paced walking. Would def be 5 star with Touch controls
With Touch support i would give 5 stars
I keep getting Profile error, something about not having a profile. I just tired to boot it up and run it... doesnt work... very sad!
NO FRENCH? But yes on ps vr!!! SHAME!!!

it just wasn't all that good, The story was pretty unsatisfying, not to mention short, i finished it in one sitting after work. puzzles are easy, i didnt really get any of the bugs anyone else complained about. the biggest one was my companion got stuck under a seesaw i made... and the graphics are really bad, bad clipping with grass and all the textures are super pixelated like BADLY pixelated, its a great concept and has so much potential, its just not there yet.

Graphics is gorgeous, storyline, sound..all together it's very nicely done!
I only wish it had Oculus touch to make it perfekt!
The levels are ill defined. when you get stuck there's nothing to reference. the levels feel oddly restricted... i just can't say i like it
This game is absolutely amazing! Just chill out and expore the wonderful world of tyson 3!

Very good game, but not sure it justifies the relatively high price-tag for suich a short game (graphics are superb).  There is most certainly room to expand on the story and I sincerely hope additional content is released soon.
still waiting for touch support :'(

review_title: Nice graphics, but too scary for me
one_reviews_text: Nice graphics, but I can not play the planetorium scene - it is too scary for me. Sadly...
it looked horible until i adjusted scale settings

Having finished it I can say the game has some of the best graphics I have seen in any VR game with stunning sci-fi backgrounds. The engine is nicely optimised and I was able to run at 2.0x super sampled with everything on high. 

There is some superb level design in here. The jungle section was probably my favorite along with the final level of the game, They have mixed 3D models with 2D billboards but it is effectively done so doesn't really detract graphically. I guess they needed to keep the frame rates up! I found the sense of scale in the game is nothing short of incredible at times. 

I did struggle sometimes to know what I should be doing next but it didn't hold me back for long. A lot of the puzzles are pretty basic but the climbing game mechanic I really liked, gave a real sense of climbing and of height and being precariously balanced at times.

The menu and info system was nicely implemented and polished.

Apart from the graphics the game failed to grab me much to start with but you need to give it some time. By the time I got to the jungle I was hooked. It is a slow paced game though, so if your looking for an action packed game then this is probably not for you. It does have its dramatic moments though! 

The found the dialog a bit weak, but Robinson is supposed to be a child. I would have preferred a more adult oriented storyline and dialog but I guess they were catering for children too.

However the experience is soon over. I spent about 8 hours in the game all told including exploring, figuring out what I was supposed to be doing next and just generally looking around. You could play through it a lot faster if just racing to get to the end.

All in all, I have been impressed with the game which has some great moments and dramatic environments which really come across well in VR.
gameplay very bad
Awsome graphics, and a good game overall. I hope Crytek will be okay, and we can get a sequel.
IM RUNNING DUAL TITAN X AND IT WILL NOT PLAY.  NO REFUND? WT? REINSTALLED TWICE.  I SHOULD  GET A REFUND.
